TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit SoapAttributeOverrides extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Allows you to override attributes applied to properties, fields, and classes when you use an <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializer> to serialize or deserialize an object as encoded SOAP.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The SoapAttributeOverrides class enables an <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializer> to override the default way of serializing a set of objects. Overriding serialization in this way has two uses: first, you can control and augment the serialization of objects found in a DLL, even if you do not have access to the source; second, you can create one set of serializable classes, but serialize the objects in multiple ways. For example, instead of serializing members of a class instance as XML elements, you can serialize them as XML attributes, resulting in a more efficient document to transport.
After you create a SoapAttributeOverrides, you create an <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlTypeMapping> using the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.SoapReflectionImporter.ImportTypeMapping%2A> method of the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.SoapReflectionImporter> class. Pass the resulting object as an argument to the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializer.%23ctor%2A> constructor. The resulting <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializer> uses the data contained by the SoapAttributeOverrides to override attributes that control how objects are serialized. To accomplish this, the SoapAttributeOverrides contains a collection of the object types that are overridden, as well as a <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.SoapAttributes> associated with each overridden object type. Each <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.SoapAttributes> contains an appropriate set of attribute objects that control how each field, property, or class is serialized.
The process for creating and using a SoapAttributeOverrides is as follows:
1. Create a <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.SoapAttributes>.
2. Create an attribute object that is appropriate to the object being overridden. For example, to override a field or property, create a <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.SoapElementAttribute>, using the new, derived type. You can optionally assign a new <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.SoapElementAttribute.ElementName%2A> that overrides the base class's attribute name or namespace.
3. Add the attribute object to the appropriate <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.SoapAttributes> property or collection. For example, you would set the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.SoapAttributes.SoapElement%2A> property of the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.SoapAttributes> object to the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.SoapElementAttribute> and specify the member name that is being overridden.
4. Create a SoapAttributeOverrides.
5. Add the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.SoapAttributes> to the SoapAttributeOverrides using the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlAttributeOverrides.Add%2A> method. If the object being overridden is a <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.SoapTypeAttribute>, you need only specify the type of the overridden object. But if you are overriding a field or property, you must also specify the name of the overridden member.
6. Create an <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlTypeMapping> using the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.SoapReflectionImporter.ImportTypeMapping%2A> method of the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.SoapReflectionImporter> class.
7. When constructing the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializer>, pass the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlTypeMapping> to the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializer.%23ctor%2A> constructor.
8. Use the resulting <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializer> to serialize or deserialize the class objects.
## Examples The following example serializes a class named `Group`. The serialization of the `GroupName` and `IgnoreThis` fields and the members of the `GroupType` enumeration are overridden. In the `CreateOverrideSerializer` method, a SoapAttributeOverrides is created, and for each overridden member or enumeration, a <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.SoapAttributes> is created with the appropriate property set and added to the SoapAttributeOverrides. An <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlTypeMapping> is created using the SoapAttributeOverrides, and that <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlTypeMapping> is used to create the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializer> that overrides the default serialization.
[!code-cpp[SoapAttributesOverrides#1](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/t-system.xml.serializati_1_1.cpp)] [!code-vb[SoapAttributesOverrides#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.xml.serializati_1_1.vb)] [!code-cs[SoapAttributesOverrides#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.xml.serializati_1_1.cs)]

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example serializes a class named `Group`. The serialization of the `GroupName` and `IgnoreThis` fields and the members of the `GroupType` enumeration are overridden. In the `CreateOverrideSerializer` method, a <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.SoapAttributeOverrides> is created, and for each overridden member or enumeration, a <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.SoapAttributes> is created with the appropriate property set and added to the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.SoapAttributeOverrides>. An <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlTypeMapping> is created using the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.SoapAttributeOverrides>, and that <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlTypeMapping> is used to create the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializer> that overrides the default serialization.

.method public hidebysig instance void Add(class System.Type type, class System.Xml.Serialization.SoapAttributes attributes) cil managed

Docs.param: The <xref:System.Type> of the object that is overridden.
A that represents the overriding attributes.
Docs.summary: Adds a to a collection of objects. The parameter specifies an object to be overridden by the .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.SoapAttributes> contains a union of attribute objects that cause the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializer> to override its default serialization behavior for a set of objects. You choose the attribute objects to place in the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.SoapAttributes>, depending on the particular behaviors you want to override. For example, the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializer> serializes a class member as an XML element by default. If you want the member to be serialized as an XML attribute instead, you would create a <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.SoapAttributeAttribute>, assign it to the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.SoapAttributes.SoapAttribute%2A> property of a <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.SoapAttributes>, and add the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlAttributes> to the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.SoapAttributeOverrides>. Use the Add method to add the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.SoapAttributes> to the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.SoapAttributeOverrides>.
Use this overload to add a <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.SoapAttributes> that contains a <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.SoapTypeAttribute>. Because the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.SoapTypeAttribute> overrides the serialization of a class, you need not specify a member of the class to override, only the type of the class.
## Examples The following example serializes a class named `Group`. The serialization of the `GroupName` and `IgnoreThis` fields and the members of the `GroupType` enumeration are overridden. In the `CreateOverrideSerializer` method, a <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.SoapAttributeOverrides> is created, and for each overridden member or enumeration, a <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.SoapAttributes> is created with the appropriate property set and added to the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.SoapAttributeOverrides>. An <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlTypeMapping> is created using the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.SoapAttributeOverrides>, and that <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlTypeMapping> is used to create the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializer> that overrides the default serialization.
[!code-cpp[SoapAttributesOverrides#1](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/4baa74d1-0793-4fb7-b1fd-_1.cpp)] [!code-vb[SoapAttributesOverrides#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/4baa74d1-0793-4fb7-b1fd-_1.vb)] [!code-cs[SoapAttributesOverrides#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/4baa74d1-0793-4fb7-b1fd-_1.cs)]

MemberSignature.Value: public void Add (Type type, string member, System.Xml.Serialization.SoapAttributes attributes);
.method public hidebysig instance void Add(class System.Type type, string member, class System.Xml.Serialization.SoapAttributes attributes) cil managed

Docs.param: The <xref:System.Type> of the object to override.
The name of the member to override.
A that represents the overriding attributes.
Docs.summary: Adds a to the collection of objects contained by the . The parameter specifies the object to be overridden by the . The parameter specifies the name of a member that is overridden.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.SoapAttributes> contains a union of attribute objects that cause the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializer> to override its default serialization behavior for a set of objects. You choose the attribute objects to place in the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.SoapAttributes>, depending on the particular behaviors you want to override. For example, the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializer> serializes a class member as an XML element by default. If you want the member to be serialized as a SOAP attribute instead, you would create a <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.SoapAttributeAttribute>, assign it to the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.SoapAttributes.SoapAttribute%2A> property of a <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.SoapAttributes>, and add the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlAttributes> to the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.SoapAttributeOverrides>. Use the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.SoapAttributeOverrides.Add%2A> method to add the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.SoapAttributes> to the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.SoapAttributeOverrides>.
Use this method when the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.SoapAttributes> contains either a <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.SoapAttributeAttribute>, <xref:System.ComponentModel.DefaultValueAttribute><xref:System.Xml.Serialization.SoapElementAttribute>, <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.SoapEnumAttribute>, or <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.SoapIgnoreAttribute>.
## Examples The following example serializes a class named `Group`. The serialization of the `GroupName` and `IgnoreThis` fields and the members of the `GroupType` enumeration are overridden. In the `CreateOverrideSerializer` method, a <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.SoapAttributeOverrides> is created, and for each overridden member or enumeration, a <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.SoapAttributes> is created with the appropriate property set and added to the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.SoapAttributeOverrides>. An <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlTypeMapping> is created using the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.SoapAttributeOverrides>, and that <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlTypeMapping> is used to create the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializer> that overrides the default serialization.
[!code-cpp[SoapAttributesOverrides#1](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/5c7f0573-851e-4df1-b9b9-_1.cpp)] [!code-vb[SoapAttributesOverrides#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/5c7f0573-851e-4df1-b9b9-_1.vb)] [!code-cs[SoapAttributesOverrides#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/5c7f0573-851e-4df1-b9b9-_1.cs)]

Docs.param: The base class <xref:System.Type> that is associated with the collection of attributes you want to retrieve.
Docs.summary: Gets the object associated with the specified (base class) type.
Docs.value: A that represents the collection of overriding attributes.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this overload to return a <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.SoapAttributes> that contains attributes for a <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.SoapTypeAttribute>.
## Examples The following example creates a <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.SoapAttributeOverrides> that is used to override the serialization of an instance of the `Group` class. The example also uses the Item property to retrieve the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.SoapAttributes> that is used to specify how the serialization is being overridden.
[!code-cs[SoapAttributeOverrides.Item property 2#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.xml.serializati_24_1.cs)] [!code-cpp[SoapAttributeOverrides.Item property 2#1](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/p-system.xml.serializati_24_1.cpp)] [!code-vb[SoapAttributeOverrides.Item property 2#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.xml.serializati_24_1.vb)]

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Xml.Serialization.SoapAttributes this[Type type, string member] { get; }
.property instance class System.Xml.Serialization.SoapAttributes Item(class System.Type, string)

Docs.param: The base class <xref:System.Type> that is associated with the collection of attributes you want to override.
The name of the overridden member that specifies the to return.
Docs.summary: Gets the object associated with the specified (base class) type. The parameter specifies the base class member that is overridden.
Docs.value: A that represents the collection of overriding attributes.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this overload to return a <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.SoapAttributes> that contains attributes that override a <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.SoapAttributeAttribute>, <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.SoapElementAttribute>, <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.SoapIgnoreAttribute>, or <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.SoapEnumAttribute>. You can also return a <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.SoapAttributes> that contains the override of a default value that uses a <xref:System.ComponentModel.DefaultValueAttribute>.
If the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.SoapAttributes> contains a <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.SoapTypeAttribute>, you must use the overload that specifies only the overridden type.
## Examples The following example creates a <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.SoapAttributeOverrides> used to override the serialization of an instance of the `Group` class. The example also uses the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.SoapAttributeOverrides.Item%2A> property to retrieve the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.SoapAttributes> that is used to specify how the serialization is being overridden.
[!code-cpp[SoapAttributeOverrides.Item property 1#1](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/a3f6a696-b3c0-4de0-9726-_1.cpp)] [!code-cs[SoapAttributeOverrides.Item property 1#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/a3f6a696-b3c0-4de0-9726-_1.cs)] [!code-vb[SoapAttributeOverrides.Item property 1#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/a3f6a696-b3c0-4de0-9726-_1.vb)]
